repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This PR updates the Python codebase to Python 3.7 syntax and features, removing old, deprecated and redundant code. [pyupgrade](https://github.com/asottile/pyupgrade) 3.15.0 was used.

The first commit includes upgrading to Python 3.0 syntax and features, including:
- utf-8 encoding is now the default ([PEP 3120](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3120/), Python 3.0+)
- Replace list comprehensions by Generator Expressions ([PEP 289](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0289/), Python 2.4+)
- Replace `yield` loop by `yield from` ([PEP 380](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0380/), Python 3.3+)
- Replace the IOError alias by OSError ([PEP 3151](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3151/), Python 3.3+)
- Remove the default subclass `(object)` when defining a class
- Use New Super syntax (PEP 3135, Python 3.0+)
- Define sets with curly braces `{}` instead of `set()`
- Remove `"r"` parameter from open function, which is default
- Remove forced `str("native")` literals
- Replace percent-formatted strings by .format() strings

The second commit includes upgrading to Python 3.6 syntax and features. The main syntax feature of Python 3.6 is f-strings ([PEP 498](https://peps.python.org/pep-0498/)), which provide more readable and performant strings.
Also a few conditional import branches (guarded behind `if sys.version_info < (3, 5):`) are removed.

The third commit uses [flynt](https://github.com/ikamensh/flynt) 1.0.1 to convert more strings to the PEP 498 f-stings.

The fourth and final commit upgraded to Python 3.7 syntax and features. No major changes, it removed a conditional import branch (guarded behind `if sys.version_info < (3, 7):`) and removed a few `__future__` imports.

Together, these changes make the codebase easier to maintain, more consistent, better readable and more performant. It effectively removes more than 350 lines of code.

commit.message:
Pyupgrade: Update codebase to Python 3 syntax and features

This commit updates the Python code to Python 3 syntax and features, removing old, depreciated and redundant code. pyupgrade 3.15.0 was used.

This includes:
- utf-8 encoding is now the default (PEP 3120, Python 3.0+)
- Replace list comprehensions by Generator Expressions (PEP 289, Python 2.4+)
- Replace yield loop by yield from (PEP 380, Python 3.3+)
- Replace the IOError alias by OSError (PEP 3151, Python 3.3+)
- Remove the default subclass (object) when defining a class
- Use New Super syntax (PEP 3135, Python 3.0+)
- Define sets with curly braces {} instead of set()
- Remove "r" parameter from open function, which is default
- Remove forced str("native") literals
- Replace percent-formatted strings by .format() strings

Pyupgrade: Update codebase to Python 3 syntax and features

This commit updates the Python code to Python 3 syntax and features, removing old, depreciated and redundant code. pyupgrade 3.15.0 was used.

This includes:
- utf-8 encoding is now the default (PEP 3120, Python 3.0+)
- Replace list comprehensions by Generator Expressions (PEP 289, Python 2.4+)
- Replace yield loop by yield from (PEP 380, Python 3.3+)
- Replace the IOError alias by OSError (PEP 3151, Python 3.3+)
- Remove the default subclass (object) when defining a class
- Use New Super syntax (PEP 3135, Python 3.0+)
- Define sets with curly braces {} instead of set()
- Remove "r" parameter from open function, which is default
- Remove forced str("native") literals
- Replace percent-formatted strings by .format() strings

commit.message:
Pyupgrade: Update codebase to Python 3.6 syntax and features

This commit updates the Python code to Python 3 syntax and features, removing old, depreciated and redundant code. pyupgrade 3.15.0 was used.

The main syntax feature of Python 3.6 is f-strings (PEP 498), which provide more readable and performant strings.

Also a few conditional import branches (guarded behind if sys.version_info < (3, 5):) are removed.

Pyupgrade: Update codebase to Python 3.6 syntax and features

This commit updates the Python code to Python 3 syntax and features, removing old, depreciated and redundant code. pyupgrade 3.15.0 was used.

The main syntax feature of Python 3.6 is f-strings (PEP 498), which provide more readable and performant strings.

Also a few conditional import branches (guarded behind if sys.version_info < (3, 5):) are removed.

commit.message:
Convert more strings to f-strings with Flynt

Used flynt 1.0.1 to convert more formatted strings to PEP 498 f-strings.

Removed a few cases that caused a SyntaxError (f-string expression part cannot include a backslash) before committing.

commit.message:
Pyupgrade: Update codebase to Python 3.7 syntax and features

This commit updates the Python code to Python 3.7 syntax and features, removing old, depreciated and redundant code. pyupgrade 3.15.0 was used with --py37-plus.

It removed a conditional import branche (guarded behind if sys.version_info < (3, 7):) and removed a few __future__ imports.

Pyupgrade: Update codebase to Python 3.7 syntax and features

This commit updates the Python code to Python 3.7 syntax and features, removing old, depreciated and redundant code. pyupgrade 3.15.0 was used with --py37-plus.

It removed a conditional import branche (guarded behind if sys.version_info < (3, 7):) and removed a few __future__ imports.

commit.message:
Fix CompileError: str objects do not support coercion to unicode

Fix this issue:

Cython/Plex/Scanners.py:91:22: str objects do not support coercion to unicode, use a unicode string literal instead (u'')

Cython.Compiler.Errors.CompileError: /Users/runner/work/cython/cython/Cython/Plex/Scanners.py
